        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>

      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Hello together,<span class="line"><!---->Hello together,<!----></span><br><br>I kindly want to inform you about the following technical thing, which could harm the user's legal rights:<span class="line"><!---->I kindly want to inform you about the following technical thing, which could harm the user's legal rights:<!----></span><br><br>* ChromeOS | Captive Portal - missing: Printing/PDF-Saving<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS | Captive Portal - missing: Printing/PDF-Saving<!----></span><br><br>Running<span class="line"><!---->Running<!----></span><br><br>* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32 bit)<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32 bit)<!----></span><br><br>Problem:<span class="line"><!---->Problem:<!----></span><br>============<span class="line"><!---->============<!----></span><br><br>During holidays I had to connect to many hotspots; on some of them I was routed via a so-called "Captive Portal"(!?), the dialogue where I had to read and agree to several terms and conditions of the several providers.<span class="line"><!---->During holidays I had to connect to many hotspots; on some of them I was routed via a so-called "Captive Portal"(!?), the dialogue where I had to read and agree to several terms and conditions of the several providers.<!----></span><br><br>These agreements are naturally legally binding for both parties.<span class="line"><!---->These agreements are naturally legally binding for both parties.<!----></span><br><br>a) Unfortunately, ChromeOS is not offering a function to conserve these contracts, as printing and/or saving as a PDF is impossible. The captive dialogue is quite "dumb" in this regard.<span class="line"><!---->a) Unfortunately, ChromeOS is not offering a function to conserve these contracts, as printing and/or saving as a PDF is impossible. The captive dialogue is quite "dumb" in this regard.<!----></span><br>==> As said, as such contracts are binding and the user does never get a copy from the provider, the user has to have a chance to store those contracts for himself to his files, either by printing and/or saving as an PDF or however else. Screenshots are not an option, as this is too complex for the very most of the usership (also, the tiny textbox/scrollbox containing the contract has to be scrolled dozens of times). It is quite fiddly.<span class="line"><!---->==&gt; As said, as such contracts are binding and the user does never get a copy from the provider, the user has to have a chance to store those contracts for himself to his files, either by printing and/or saving as an PDF or however else. Screenshots are not an option, as this is too complex for the very most of the usership (also, the tiny textbox/scrollbox containing the contract has to be scrolled dozens of times). It is quite fiddly.<!----></span><br><br>b) Captive Portal is a modal ChromeOS window, means, you have to answer/abort before doing anything else.<span class="line"><!---->b) Captive Portal is a modal ChromeOS window, means, you have to answer/abort before doing anything else.<!----></span><br>==> The user cannot use his offline dictionary app to translate foreign-language words and passages that he does not understand under the terms and conditions. However, the translation is absolutely necessary in order to understand which contract content you agree to. Unfortunately, Chrome forbids that.<span class="line"><!---->==&gt; The user cannot use his offline dictionary app to translate foreign-language words and passages that he does not understand under the terms and conditions. However, the translation is absolutely necessary in order to understand which contract content you agree to. Unfortunately, Chrome forbids that.<!----></span><br><br>c) Side note (more a bug): Also the modal captive portal is on top of the screen, the back-key still controls the still partly visible browser window in the background. Here: Chrome is open and probably some work done but not sent, WLAN connected and then the pop-up (for open the portal) clicked.<span class="line"><!---->c) Side note (more a bug): Also the modal captive portal is on top of the screen, the back-key still controls the still partly visible browser window in the background. Here: Chrome is open and probably some work done but not sent, WLAN connected and then the pop-up (for open the portal) clicked.<!----></span><br><br>##################<span class="line"><!---->##################<!----></span><br><br>For sure you are wondering why I am reporting that as a security vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->For sure you are wondering why I am reporting that as a security vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>"It's just a feature request!" would be the half of the truth only. Indeed, it is not a vulnerability in the classical sense, but the legal rights of the valued user could be harmed severely.<span class="line"><!---->"It's just a feature request!" would be the half of the truth only. Indeed, it is not a vulnerability in the classical sense, but the legal rights of the valued user could be harmed severely.<!----></span><br><br>Why? The ChromeOS user cannot display the contract he has agreed to in the case there are dissensions with or claims by the provider. Dissensions of any kind, e.g. fees, using conditions, liability under the contract etc.<span class="line"><!---->Why? The ChromeOS user cannot display the contract he has agreed to in the case there are dissensions with or claims by the provider. Dissensions of any kind, e.g. fees, using conditions, liability under the contract etc.<!----></span><br>Or phrases he had agreed to but not understood due to the missing dictionary access.<span class="line"><!---->Or phrases he had agreed to but not understood due to the missing dictionary access.<!----></span><br><br>The user is lost. <span class="line"><!---->The user is lost. <!----></span><br><br>##################<span class="line"><!---->##################<!----></span><br><br>Expectation:<span class="line"><!---->Expectation:<!----></span><br>============<span class="line"><!---->============<!----></span><br><br>Captive Portal Dialogue has to offer the possibility to conserve the contract to the disk (PDF and/or HTML with full layout) or print it, including timestamp and full URL. Only then the user has a chance to show what he has legally agreed to; otherwise the provider could say what he want - the user cannot prove the opposite.<span class="line"><!---->Captive Portal Dialogue has to offer the possibility to conserve the contract to the disk (PDF and/or HTML with full layout) or print it, including timestamp and full URL. Only then the user has a chance to show what he has legally agreed to; otherwise the provider could say what he want - the user cannot prove the opposite.<!----></span><br><br>Beware: The tiny textboxes (usually scrollable) have to be expanded insofar that the whole(!) text is visible within the PDF. Maximum width/height would be irrelevant then, respectively set to the page dimensions.<span class="line"><!---->Beware: The tiny textboxes (usually scrollable) have to be expanded insofar that the whole(!) text is visible within the PDF. Maximum width/height would be irrelevant then, respectively set to the page dimensions.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for checking this unusual kind of vulnerability on occasion.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for checking this unusual kind of vulnerability on occasion.<!----></span><br><br><br>If you believe it would be nevertheless a "feature request" (for me: no), I would be glad if you would forward it to the appropriate Team. In that case please add the label for restricting view to Google, since providers/hotel etc do not have to be brought to stupid thoughts.<span class="line"><!---->If you believe it would be nevertheless a "feature request" (for me: no), I would be glad if you would forward it to the appropriate Team. In that case please add the label for restricting view to Google, since providers/hotel etc do not have to be brought to stupid thoughts.<!----></span><br><br>I hope it is clear enough.<span class="line"><!---->I hope it is clear enough.<!----></span><br><br>Best regards<span class="line"><!---->Best regards<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
      <div>
        
      </div>
    <mr-description></mr-description>

          Comment 9<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368317#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      steve...@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/780345163" title="steve...@google.com"><!---->steve...@google.com<!----></a>
      steve...@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->steve...@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Nov 1, 2022, 12:17 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Nov 1, 2022, 12:17 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368317#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Nov 1, 2022, 12:17 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368317#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Nov 1, 2022, 12:17 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        We don't really have a better way to resolve this (BlockedOn is not a status). We didn't do anything specific to "fix" this, we just redesigned the UI such that it is no longer an issue.<span class="line"><!---->We don't really have a better way to resolve this (BlockedOn is not a status). We didn't do anything specific to "fix" this, we just redesigned the UI such that it is no longer an issue.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately buganizer is an internal tracker. The description of that issue is "Open captive portal signin content in a tab by default".<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately buganizer is an internal tracker. The description of that issue is "Open captive portal signin content in a tab by default".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Hello together,<span class="line"><!---->Hello together,<!----></span><br><br>I kindly want to inform you about the following technical thing, which could harm the user's legal rights:<span class="line"><!---->I kindly want to inform you about the following technical thing, which could harm the user's legal rights:<!----></span><br><br>* ChromeOS | Captive Portal - missing: Printing/PDF-Saving<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS | Captive Portal - missing: Printing/PDF-Saving<!----></span><br><br>Running<span class="line"><!---->Running<!----></span><br><br>* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32 bit)<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32 bit)<!----></span><br><br>Problem:<span class="line"><!---->Problem:<!----></span><br>============<span class="line"><!---->============<!----></span><br><br>During holidays I had to connect to many hotspots; on some of them I was routed via a so-called "Captive Portal"(!?), the dialogue where I had to read and agree to several terms and conditions of the several providers.<span class="line"><!---->During holidays I had to connect to many hotspots; on some of them I was routed via a so-called "Captive Portal"(!?), the dialogue where I had to read and agree to several terms and conditions of the several providers.<!----></span><br><br>These agreements are naturally legally binding for both parties.<span class="line"><!---->These agreements are naturally legally binding for both parties.<!----></span><br><br>a) Unfortunately, ChromeOS is not offering a function to conserve these contracts, as printing and/or saving as a PDF is impossible. The captive dialogue is quite "dumb" in this regard.<span class="line"><!---->a) Unfortunately, ChromeOS is not offering a function to conserve these contracts, as printing and/or saving as a PDF is impossible. The captive dialogue is quite "dumb" in this regard.<!----></span><br>==> As said, as such contracts are binding and the user does never get a copy from the provider, the user has to have a chance to store those contracts for himself to his files, either by printing and/or saving as an PDF or however else. Screenshots are not an option, as this is too complex for the very most of the usership (also, the tiny textbox/scrollbox containing the contract has to be scrolled dozens of times). It is quite fiddly.<span class="line"><!---->==&gt; As said, as such contracts are binding and the user does never get a copy from the provider, the user has to have a chance to store those contracts for himself to his files, either by printing and/or saving as an PDF or however else. Screenshots are not an option, as this is too complex for the very most of the usership (also, the tiny textbox/scrollbox containing the contract has to be scrolled dozens of times). It is quite fiddly.<!----></span><br><br>b) Captive Portal is a modal ChromeOS window, means, you have to answer/abort before doing anything else.<span class="line"><!---->b) Captive Portal is a modal ChromeOS window, means, you have to answer/abort before doing anything else.<!----></span><br>==> The user cannot use his offline dictionary app to translate foreign-language words and passages that he does not understand under the terms and conditions. However, the translation is absolutely necessary in order to understand which contract content you agree to. Unfortunately, Chrome forbids that.<span class="line"><!---->==&gt; The user cannot use his offline dictionary app to translate foreign-language words and passages that he does not understand under the terms and conditions. However, the translation is absolutely necessary in order to understand which contract content you agree to. Unfortunately, Chrome forbids that.<!----></span><br><br>c) Side note (more a bug): Also the modal captive portal is on top of the screen, the back-key still controls the still partly visible browser window in the background. Here: Chrome is open and probably some work done but not sent, WLAN connected and then the pop-up (for open the portal) clicked.<span class="line"><!---->c) Side note (more a bug): Also the modal captive portal is on top of the screen, the back-key still controls the still partly visible browser window in the background. Here: Chrome is open and probably some work done but not sent, WLAN connected and then the pop-up (for open the portal) clicked.<!----></span><br><br>##################<span class="line"><!---->##################<!----></span><br><br>For sure you are wondering why I am reporting that as a security vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->For sure you are wondering why I am reporting that as a security vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>"It's just a feature request!" would be the half of the truth only. Indeed, it is not a vulnerability in the classical sense, but the legal rights of the valued user could be harmed severely.<span class="line"><!---->"It's just a feature request!" would be the half of the truth only. Indeed, it is not a vulnerability in the classical sense, but the legal rights of the valued user could be harmed severely.<!----></span><br><br>Why? The ChromeOS user cannot display the contract he has agreed to in the case there are dissensions with or claims by the provider. Dissensions of any kind, e.g. fees, using conditions, liability under the contract etc.<span class="line"><!---->Why? The ChromeOS user cannot display the contract he has agreed to in the case there are dissensions with or claims by the provider. Dissensions of any kind, e.g. fees, using conditions, liability under the contract etc.<!----></span><br>Or phrases he had agreed to but not understood due to the missing dictionary access.<span class="line"><!---->Or phrases he had agreed to but not understood due to the missing dictionary access.<!----></span><br><br>The user is lost. <span class="line"><!---->The user is lost. <!----></span><br><br>##################<span class="line"><!---->##################<!----></span><br><br>Expectation:<span class="line"><!---->Expectation:<!----></span><br>============<span class="line"><!---->============<!----></span><br><br>Captive Portal Dialogue has to offer the possibility to conserve the contract to the disk (PDF and/or HTML with full layout) or print it, including timestamp and full URL. Only then the user has a chance to show what he has legally agreed to; otherwise the provider could say what he want - the user cannot prove the opposite.<span class="line"><!---->Captive Portal Dialogue has to offer the possibility to conserve the contract to the disk (PDF and/or HTML with full layout) or print it, including timestamp and full URL. Only then the user has a chance to show what he has legally agreed to; otherwise the provider could say what he want - the user cannot prove the opposite.<!----></span><br><br>Beware: The tiny textboxes (usually scrollable) have to be expanded insofar that the whole(!) text is visible within the PDF. Maximum width/height would be irrelevant then, respectively set to the page dimensions.<span class="line"><!---->Beware: The tiny textboxes (usually scrollable) have to be expanded insofar that the whole(!) text is visible within the PDF. Maximum width/height would be irrelevant then, respectively set to the page dimensions.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for checking this unusual kind of vulnerability on occasion.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for checking this unusual kind of vulnerability on occasion.<!----></span><br><br><br>If you believe it would be nevertheless a "feature request" (for me: no), I would be glad if you would forward it to the appropriate Team. In that case please add the label for restricting view to Google, since providers/hotel etc do not have to be brought to stupid thoughts.<span class="line"><!---->If you believe it would be nevertheless a "feature request" (for me: no), I would be glad if you would forward it to the appropriate Team. In that case please add the label for restricting view to Google, since providers/hotel etc do not have to be brought to stupid thoughts.<!----></span><br><br>I hope it is clear enough.<span class="line"><!---->I hope it is clear enough.<!----></span><br><br>Best regards<span class="line"><!---->Best regards<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }

          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      </option>

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Hello together,<span class="line"><!---->Hello together,<!----></span><br><br>I kindly want to inform you about the following technical thing, which could harm the user's legal rights:<span class="line"><!---->I kindly want to inform you about the following technical thing, which could harm the user's legal rights:<!----></span><br><br>* ChromeOS | Captive Portal - missing: Printing/PDF-Saving<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS | Captive Portal - missing: Printing/PDF-Saving<!----></span><br><br>Running<span class="line"><!---->Running<!----></span><br><br>* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32 bit)<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32 bit)<!----></span><br><br>Problem:<span class="line"><!---->Problem:<!----></span><br>============<span class="line"><!---->============<!----></span><br><br>During holidays I had to connect to many hotspots; on some of them I was routed via a so-called "Captive Portal"(!?), the dialogue where I had to read and agree to several terms and conditions of the several providers.<span class="line"><!---->During holidays I had to connect to many hotspots; on some of them I was routed via a so-called "Captive Portal"(!?), the dialogue where I had to read and agree to several terms and conditions of the several providers.<!----></span><br><br>These agreements are naturally legally binding for both parties.<span class="line"><!---->These agreements are naturally legally binding for both parties.<!----></span><br><br>a) Unfortunately, ChromeOS is not offering a function to conserve these contracts, as printing and/or saving as a PDF is impossible. The captive dialogue is quite "dumb" in this regard.<span class="line"><!---->a) Unfortunately, ChromeOS is not offering a function to conserve these contracts, as printing and/or saving as a PDF is impossible. The captive dialogue is quite "dumb" in this regard.<!----></span><br>==> As said, as such contracts are binding and the user does never get a copy from the provider, the user has to have a chance to store those contracts for himself to his files, either by printing and/or saving as an PDF or however else. Screenshots are not an option, as this is too complex for the very most of the usership (also, the tiny textbox/scrollbox containing the contract has to be scrolled dozens of times). It is quite fiddly.<span class="line"><!---->==&gt; As said, as such contracts are binding and the user does never get a copy from the provider, the user has to have a chance to store those contracts for himself to his files, either by printing and/or saving as an PDF or however else. Screenshots are not an option, as this is too complex for the very most of the usership (also, the tiny textbox/scrollbox containing the contract has to be scrolled dozens of times). It is quite fiddly.<!----></span><br><br>b) Captive Portal is a modal ChromeOS window, means, you have to answer/abort before doing anything else.<span class="line"><!---->b) Captive Portal is a modal ChromeOS window, means, you have to answer/abort before doing anything else.<!----></span><br>==> The user cannot use his offline dictionary app to translate foreign-language words and passages that he does not understand under the terms and conditions. However, the translation is absolutely necessary in order to understand which contract content you agree to. Unfortunately, Chrome forbids that.<span class="line"><!---->==&gt; The user cannot use his offline dictionary app to translate foreign-language words and passages that he does not understand under the terms and conditions. However, the translation is absolutely necessary in order to understand which contract content you agree to. Unfortunately, Chrome forbids that.<!----></span><br><br>c) Side note (more a bug): Also the modal captive portal is on top of the screen, the back-key still controls the still partly visible browser window in the background. Here: Chrome is open and probably some work done but not sent, WLAN connected and then the pop-up (for open the portal) clicked.<span class="line"><!---->c) Side note (more a bug): Also the modal captive portal is on top of the screen, the back-key still controls the still partly visible browser window in the background. Here: Chrome is open and probably some work done but not sent, WLAN connected and then the pop-up (for open the portal) clicked.<!----></span><br><br>##################<span class="line"><!---->##################<!----></span><br><br>For sure you are wondering why I am reporting that as a security vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->For sure you are wondering why I am reporting that as a security vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>"It's just a feature request!" would be the half of the truth only. Indeed, it is not a vulnerability in the classical sense, but the legal rights of the valued user could be harmed severely.<span class="line"><!---->"It's just a feature request!" would be the half of the truth only. Indeed, it is not a vulnerability in the classical sense, but the legal rights of the valued user could be harmed severely.<!----></span><br><br>Why? The ChromeOS user cannot display the contract he has agreed to in the case there are dissensions with or claims by the provider. Dissensions of any kind, e.g. fees, using conditions, liability under the contract etc.<span class="line"><!---->Why? The ChromeOS user cannot display the contract he has agreed to in the case there are dissensions with or claims by the provider. Dissensions of any kind, e.g. fees, using conditions, liability under the contract etc.<!----></span><br>Or phrases he had agreed to but not understood due to the missing dictionary access.<span class="line"><!---->Or phrases he had agreed to but not understood due to the missing dictionary access.<!----></span><br><br>The user is lost. <span class="line"><!---->The user is lost. <!----></span><br><br>##################<span class="line"><!---->##################<!----></span><br><br>Expectation:<span class="line"><!---->Expectation:<!----></span><br>============<span class="line"><!---->============<!----></span><br><br>Captive Portal Dialogue has to offer the possibility to conserve the contract to the disk (PDF and/or HTML with full layout) or print it, including timestamp and full URL. Only then the user has a chance to show what he has legally agreed to; otherwise the provider could say what he want - the user cannot prove the opposite.<span class="line"><!---->Captive Portal Dialogue has to offer the possibility to conserve the contract to the disk (PDF and/or HTML with full layout) or print it, including timestamp and full URL. Only then the user has a chance to show what he has legally agreed to; otherwise the provider could say what he want - the user cannot prove the opposite.<!----></span><br><br>Beware: The tiny textboxes (usually scrollable) have to be expanded insofar that the whole(!) text is visible within the PDF. Maximum width/height would be irrelevant then, respectively set to the page dimensions.<span class="line"><!---->Beware: The tiny textboxes (usually scrollable) have to be expanded insofar that the whole(!) text is visible within the PDF. Maximum width/height would be irrelevant then, respectively set to the page dimensions.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for checking this unusual kind of vulnerability on occasion.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for checking this unusual kind of vulnerability on occasion.<!----></span><br><br><br>If you believe it would be nevertheless a "feature request" (for me: no), I would be glad if you would forward it to the appropriate Team. In that case please add the label for restricting view to Google, since providers/hotel etc do not have to be brought to stupid thoughts.<span class="line"><!---->If you believe it would be nevertheless a "feature request" (for me: no), I would be glad if you would forward it to the appropriate Team. In that case please add the label for restricting view to Google, since providers/hotel etc do not have to be brought to stupid thoughts.<!----></span><br><br>I hope it is clear enough.<span class="line"><!---->I hope it is clear enough.<!----></span><br><br>Best regards<span class="line"><!---->Best regards<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
      <div>
        
      </div>
    <mr-description></mr-description>

          Comment 8<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368317#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      hesse...@googlemail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1865886854" title="hesse...@googlemail.com"><!---->hesse...@googlemail.com<!----></a>
      hesse...@googlemail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->hesse...@googlemail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        We don't really have a better way to resolve this (BlockedOn is not a status). We didn't do anything specific to "fix" this, we just redesigned the UI such that it is no longer an issue.<span class="line"><!---->We don't really have a better way to resolve this (BlockedOn is not a status).             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
